author: Colleen Kane
title: Cubs-Cardinals Game 1 updates
text:
Colleen Kane Contact Reporter Chicago Tribune 
For the first time in their storied 123-year rivalry, the Cubs and Cardinals meet in the postseason Friday night at Busch Stadium. 
Cubs left-hander Jon Lester faces off against Cardinals right-hander John Lackey, his former Red Sox teammate, in the first game of the best-of-five National League Division Series. 
The Cardinals won 11 of 19 meetings during the regular season, while Lester was 1-3 with a 2.59 ERA in five starts against St. Louis. 
Cubs manager Joe Maddon, a Cardinals fan as a child, said before Friday’s game that it was meaningful to be a part of the historical meeting. 
“It's unbelievable that it's the first time that we're facing each other like this, and that to me is pretty special,” Maddon said. “To be involved in that first meeting from the other side, now that I am a Cub, and I'm really relishing the fact that I am, moving forward, it's just kind of crazy how the paths cross in an eventual moment within your lifetime. I feel fortunate to be in this moment.”
